title.de: GENTECHNISCH VERÄNDERTE PFLANZEN MIT VERBESSERTER TROCKENRESISTENZ UND VERFAHREN ZU DEREN HERSTELLUNG
title.en: GENETICALLY MODIFIED PLANTS WITH ENHANCED DROUGHT RESISTANCE AND METHODS FOR PRODUCING THE SAME
title.fr: PLANTES GÉNÉTIQUEMENT MODIFIÉES AVEC RÉSISTANCE AMÉLIORÉE À LA SÉCHERESSE ET PROCÉDÉS POUR LES PRODUIRE

bibliographic_data.abstract: The present invention relates to genetically modified plants with enhanced drought resistance through the introduction of specific drought-tolerance genes. The modified plants exhibit improved water use efficiency, reduced water loss, and maintained crop yield under water-stress conditions. The invention includes methods for introducing drought-resistance genes using CRISPR-Cas9 technology, plant transformation protocols, and selection markers for identifying successfully modified plants. The resulting transgenic plants show significant improvements in survival rates and productivity in arid and semi-arid environments.

paragraphs.text: The present invention relates to the field of plant biotechnology and genetic engineering, specifically to the development of genetically modified crops with enhanced drought resistance for sustainable agriculture in water-limited environments.

Climate change and increasing global population present significant challenges to food security. Drought stress is one of the major abiotic factors limiting crop productivity worldwide, affecting billions of people who depend on agriculture for their livelihoods.

Traditional breeding methods for developing drought-resistant crops are time-consuming and often insufficient to meet the growing demands. Modern genetic engineering techniques offer promising solutions for rapid development of climate-resilient crops.

The present invention provides genetically modified plants with superior drought tolerance achieved through targeted gene editing and introduction of drought-resistance genes, offering a sustainable solution for agriculture in water-scarce regions.

claims.text: A genetically modified plant comprising at least one drought-resistance gene selected from the group consisting of DREB2A, P5CS, and LEA proteins, wherein the plant exhibits enhanced water use efficiency compared to wild-type plants.
The genetically modified plant according to claim 1, wherein the drought-resistance gene is introduced using CRISPR-Cas9 technology.
A method for producing drought-resistant plants comprising: introducing drought-tolerance genes into plant cells; selecting transformed cells; and regenerating plants from the selected cells.
The method according to claim 3, wherein the plant is selected from the group consisting of wheat, corn, rice, soybean, and cotton.
